intro: Brachystelma kolarense, commonly known as the Kolarens rock-dove, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant is typically found growing on rocky outcrops and in arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers, which bloom in shades of yellow and orange, are small but numerous, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Brachystelma kolarense is a hardy, drought-tolerant plant that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
